entries.title: Key takeaways from Zelensky's historic visit to Washington
entries.description: Three-hundred days after his country was invaded by Russia, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky jetted to Washington, DC, for talks on what the next 300 days might bring.

entries.title: Sea turtle amputee rescued from net entanglement finds forever home
entries.description: The National Marine Aquarium, the largest display for sea life in the United Kingdom, has officially welcomed Heidi, an olive ridley turtle rescued in 2018 from the Maldives.

entries.title: Expert says the Patriot missiles are 'not a game changer.' Hear why
entries.description: CNN Pentagon correspondent Oren Liebermann explains the significance of Patriot missiles.

entries.title: Zelensky delivers message to Putin from inside the White House
entries.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky shares a message for Putin from a joint press conference with President Joe Biden at the White House.

entries.title: Netanyahu informs Israeli president he has formed government
entries.description: Benjamin Netanyahu has officially informed Israeli President Isaac Herzog that he has successfully formed a government, his Likud party said Wednesday.

entries.title: Alleged kingpin accused of running multibillion-dollar meth empire extradited to Australia
entries.description: Tse Chi Lop, an alleged drug kingpin accused of running a multibillion dollar methamphetamine empire, has been extradited to Australia following a nearly two-year legal battle with Dutch authorities.

entries.title: After years of investigating, Jan. 6 panel will release final report
entries.description: • Trump paid no federal income tax in his last year as president

entries.title: Listen to Zelensky's message to Americans from Oval Office
entries.description: President Joe Biden and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky speak in the Oval Office during a historic visit to Washington amid Russia's ongoing war in Ukraine.

entries.title: John Mayer reveals inspiration for 'Your Body Is a Wonderland'
entries.description: John Mayer has put to rest the theory that "Your Body Is A Wonderland" is about one of his former celebrity girlfriends.

entries.title: 'Luck might have finally run out' for air travelers
entries.description: Winter certainly is arriving with a bang in the United States. An arctic blast and bomb cyclone will push through most of the country as the season officially starts, and that's bound to bring disruptions for millions of holiday travelers.

entries.title: Patriot missile systems will help Ukraine defend against Russian attacks, but experts say they are 'not a game changer'
entries.description: The US announced this week that it is providing a Patriot missile battery to Ukraine — but experts say that while it will be a valuable addition to the beleaguered country's air defense, it's not a cure-all.

entries.title: Police: School bus video shows missing 11-year-old just days before her disappearance
entries.description: Authorities in North Carolina have released a school bus surveillance video they say shows missing 11-year-old Madalina Cojocari just days before her mother and stepfather said they last saw her.

entries.title: Protests erupt as Taliban suspends university education for Afghan women
entries.description: The Taliban government has suspended university education for all female students in Afghanistan, the latest step in its brutal clampdown on the rights and freedoms of Afghan women. CNN's Nada Bashir has the details.

entries.title: After years of investigating, Jan. 6 panel will release final report
Dolphins show hallmarks of Alzheimer's disease, new study suggests
entries.description: The brains of three species of dolphin found stranded along the Scottish coast have shown the hallmarks of Alzheimer's disease, according to new research, providing greater insight into the disease in species other than humans.

entries.title: Capturing Messi's viral moment: The story behind the most liked photo on Instagram
entries.description: Lionel Messi sits on Sergio Aguero's shoulders, both hands clasped firmly on the World Cup trophy as he holds it aloft.

entries.title: Infamous French serial killer, Charles 'The Serpent' Sobhraj, ordered to be released
entries.description: Nepal's top court on Wednesday ordered the release from jail of Charles Sobhraj, the infamous French serial killer who inspired the award-nominated TV series "The Serpent."

entries.title: Alicia Silverstone poses nude for PETA
entries.description: Alicia Silverstone is going nude in the name of animals.

entries.title: The best space photos of 2022
Video gamers sue Microsoft in US court to stop Activision takeover
entries.description: Microsoft Corp was hit on Tuesday in US court with a private consumer lawsuit claiming the technology company's $69 billion bid to purchase "Call of Duty" maker Activision Blizzard Inc will unlawfully squelch competition in the video game industry.

entries.title: Analysis: Biden is set to unveil $1.8B weapons deal for Ukraine. Here's how it could affect the war
entries.description: US President Joe Biden is expected to announce an additional $1.8 billion in security assistance to Ukraine during President Volodymyr Zelensky's expected visit to the White House. The significant boost in aid is expected to be headlined by the Patriot missile defense systems that are included in the package, a US official told CNN.

entries.title: Pittsburgh Steelers legend Franco Harris, known for 'Immaculate Reception,' dead at age 72
entries.description: Pittsburgh Steelers great Franco Harris, who was arguably best known for one of the most iconic plays in NFL history -- dubbed the "Immaculate Reception" -- has died at the age of 72, the Pro Football Hall of Fame announced on Wednesday.

entries.title: Thousands still without power after California earthquake
entries.description: More than 14,000 customers remain without power Wednesday in Humboldt County, California, after a 6.4 magnitude earthquake struck, according to poweroutage.us.

entries.title: Why the National Weather Service is calling this a 'once-in-a-generation event'
entries.description: A developing "bomb cyclone" prompted alerts for tens of millions of people from Washington state to Maryland, according to the National Weather Service. The storm will affect much of the country, but the most serious effects will be a blizzard in the Midwest on Thursday and Friday. CNN meteorologist Jennifer Gray has the details.

entries.title: Elizabeth Hurley hits out at British Airways after being 'stranded' in Antigua
entries.description: Hollywood actress Elizabeth Hurley has warned fans to "avoid flying," saying she was left "stranded" at Antigua airport for more than 12 hours when her British Airways flight was delayed.

entries.title: House Jan. 6 committee to release final report
6 incredible video moments from 2022
entries.description: A close call with a great white shark. A groom's proposal goes overboard. A seven-year-old acquires a taste for wine. These are the best video moments of 2022:

entries.title: Rumer Willis is expecting her first child
entries.description: The Willis-Moore clan is getting ready to welcome a new member.

entries.title: Look up to the sky for the last meteor shower of the year
entries.description: A gift from the skies is coming just in time for the holidays — the Ursids meteor shower. This celestial event will be the last meteor shower of 2022.

entries.title: 'Do you have an ID?:' Police catch runaway llama
entries.description: Video shows police officers and animal protection police chasing a llama that escaped from her shelter.

entries.title: B-2 nuke bomber fleet is temporarily grounded due to safety issue
entries.description: The Air Force's fleet of B-2 Spirit bombers is temporarily grounded after one of the aircraft had an in-flight malfunction earlier this month.

entries.title: Pelosi's California home didn't receive security review in four years before October's violent attack, Capitol Police chief says
entries.description: Before the violent attack on her husband in late October, the security of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's California home had not been assessed by United States Capitol Police since 2018, Police Chief Thomas Manger told CNN's Pamela Brown in an exclusive interview Tuesday.

entries.title: The UK just took a step closer to space flight
entries.description: The United Kingdom is one step closer to conducting its first ever satellite launch from its own shores.

entries.title: 10 new train journeys for 2023
entries.description: While governments prevaricate over climate change measures, millions of travelers worldwide have been voting with their feet and switching to trains as their preferred mode of transport.

entries.title: Japan just delivered a lump of coal to investors across the globe
entries.description: Wall Street just received a big lump of Christmas coal.

entries.title: Football, gas and bribery allegations: How Qatar-EU relations deteriorated
entries.description: As the world's attention was focused on the conclusion of the World Cup in Qatar last week, a political scandal was brewing in Europe with the small gas-rich nation at its center.

entries.title: Boris Becker: Tennis great says a prison inmate tried to kill him while in UK jail
entries.description: Boris Becker says a prison "inmate tried to kill" him during the tennis great's incarceration in a British jail during an interview that was aired Tuesday by German broadcaster Sat 1.

entries.title: Ukrainian President travels to Washington to meet with Biden and address Congress, in a bid to rally US support for Ukraine's defense
Why I'm choosing not to see 'The Whale'
entries.description: As Darren Aronofsky's "The Whale" -- which has been in select theaters -- opens in theaters around the country this week, the film could become a powerful empathy generator. Just perhaps not in the way it was intended.

entries.title: See what it's like in the UK as strikes bring country to a halt
entries.description: The cost of living crisis and soaring inflation in the UK have left Britons worse off this year. As the holiday season approaches, nurses, joining railway workers and postal workers, staged their biggest walkout in decades. CNN's Nada Bashir has more.

entries.title: Argentine stars Lionel Messi and Rodrigo De Paul fly in helicopter over parade due to crowd size
entries.description: Argentine national soccer team stars Lionel Messi and Rodrigo De Paul, along with coach Lionel Scaloni, were forced to fly in a helicopter over a historic monument in the center of Buenos Aires after their bus got stuck in the massive crowds gathered to watch the parade celebrating the country's World Cup victory, Argentine federal police said on Tuesday.

entries.title: Exclusive: Biden task force investigating how US tech ends up in Iranian attack drones used against Ukraine
entries.description: The Biden administration has launched an expansive task force to investigate how US and western components, including American-made microelectronics, are ending up in Iranian-made drones Russia is launching by the hundreds into Ukraine, multiple officials familiar with the effort tell CNN.

entries.title: Germany hands over 20 looted Benin Bronzes to Nigeria
entries.description: Germany has handed over 20 Benin Bronzes from its museums to Nigeria, German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock said on Tuesday, making it the latest European country to return cultural artifacts to their African homeland.

entries.title: Endangered pink iguana hatchlings seen for the first time on Galapagos island
entries.description: Scientists have discovered hatchling and juvenile populations of the Galapagos pink land iguana, an endangered reptile native to a sole island on the Ecuadorean archipelago, for the first time since the species' discovery just decades ago.

entries.title: See Messi and teammates' bus cruise through jubilant Buenos Aires
entries.description: Argentina's capital Buenos Aires was brought to a standstill as football player Lionel Messi and his teammates traveled through the city in an open air bus after their stunning win of the 2022 World Cup. Journalist Stefano Pozzebon has more.

entries.title: YouTubers, doping and greed: It's been a tough year for boxing
entries.description: Simiso Buthelezi, Miracle Amaeze and Luis Quiñones are some of the talented boxers who have died this year as they pursued their sporting careers and chased dreams of world titles.

entries.title: Thousands of tech jobs cut as China's unemployment crisis deepens
entries.description: Xiaomi, one of the world's largest smartphone makers, has begun layoffs in China at a time when the world's second largest economy is grappling with an enormous unemployment crisis.

entries.title: Why the future of our cities might be headed underground
entries.description: There is a megaproject underway that's not so much breaking new ground, as burrowing beneath it. In Singapore, a series of extensive tunnels are being bored into the soil some 60 meters down -- below subterranean shopping malls and even the city's metro.

entries.title: Winter solstice 2022: Shortest day of the year is long on pagan rituals
entries.description: For the past six months, the days have grown shorter and the nights have grown longer in the Northern Hemisphere. But that's about to reverse itself.

entries.title: Zelensky aims to rally US support for Ukraine's defense in Washington visit
entries.description:
• Live: Zelensky says he is en route to US to meet Biden and address Congress
• Analysis: Why Zelensky's US visit is so hugely significant

entries.title: China's Covid 'chaos': How a shortage of fever drugs is sparking a global run on medicines
Children among dead as stranded Rohingya face starvation at sea, families say
entries.description: Two children and a woman are among many Rohingya refugees feared dead at sea more than three weeks after their boat became stranded off the Indian coast, where at least 160 people remain aboard on the brink of starvation, family members and aid agencies said.

entries.title: Thai warship that sank, killing 6, had too few life jackets, admiral says
entries.description: Thai naval officials said Tuesday there were not enough life jackets for everyone aboard a warship that sank early Monday in severe weather in the Gulf of Thailand with the loss of at least six lives.

entries.title: As China's Covid cases skyrocket, patients are told to go back to work
entries.description: Just weeks ago, catching Covid in China meant being taken to government quarantine for an indeterminate stay and your entire residential building being locked down, trapping neighbors in their homes for days or weeks.

entries.title: Biden to announce $1.8 billion in new assistance during Zelensky visit
Analysis: Why Zelensky's surprise US visit is so hugely significant
entries.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky's White House visit Wednesday will symbolically bolster America's role as the arsenal of democracy in the bitter war for Ukraine's survival and send a stunning public rebuke to Russian President Vladimir Putin.

entries.title: Zelensky aims to rally US support for Ukraine's defense in Washington visit
Satellite images reveal changes at key Russian military bases in the Arctic
entries.description: Despite its startling Ukraine losses, Russia continues to expand its Arctic defenses, which leaves NATO edgy. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reports.

entries.title: Lionel Messi's World Cup photos are most-liked Instagram post ever
entries.description: A photo gallery by Argentine footballer Lionel Messi has become the most-liked Instagram post ever.

entries.title: Russia's militarization of the Arctic shows no sign of slowing down
entries.description: Russia has continued expanding its military bases in the Arctic region despite significant losses in its war on Ukraine, according to a new series of satellite images obtained by CNN.

entries.title: 8 teenage girls charged with second-degree murder in fatal stabbing of Toronto man
entries.description: Eight teenage girls were charged with murder Tuesday in the stabbing death of a 59-year-old Toronto man in what police are calling a "swarming" attack.

entries.title: Read: Committee's report finding Trump was not properly audited by IRS as president
Read: Second report summarizing review of Trump's taxes
entries.description: The Democratic-led House Ways and Means Committee on Tuesday released a supplemental report from the Joint Committee on Taxation that offered a summary of its review of tax returns between 2015 and 2020 for Trump and several of his businesses.

entries.title: Read: House Committee's summary report on Trump's taxes
entries.description: The Democratic-led House Ways and Means Committee voted Tuesday to make public former President Donald Trump's tax returns once they are redacted for personal information.

entries.title: 18 of Asia's most underrated places
entries.description: Comprising more than 40 countries, Asia can't be summed up easily.

entries.title: TikTok executive refuses Jake Tapper's multiple requests to acknowledge China's Uyghur genocide
entries.description: In an interview with CNN's Jake Tapper Tuesday, a TikTok executive refused multiple times to acknowledge China's treatment of Uyghurs and other Muslim minorities, actions the US State Department labeled a genocide and a United Nations report said may constitute "crimes against humanity."

entries.title: China reports few Covid deaths since easing restrictions. What CNN sees tells a different story
entries.description: Beijing is facing a Covid outbreak two weeks after easing lockdown restrictions, but the country is only reporting a few deaths from the disease. CNN's Selina Wang reports.

entries.title: After convicting Harvey Weinstein of rape, a Los Angeles jury deadlocks on factors that could have increased his sentence
entries.description: After convicting former film producer Harvey Weinstein of rape and sexual assault, a Los Angeles jury could not reach a unanimous verdict Tuesday on alleged aggravating factors that could have increased his sentence.

entries.title: Appeals court rejects China Telecom bid to reverse US ban
entries.description: A federal appeals court on Tuesday rejected China Telecom Corp's challenge to a Federal Communications Commission order withdrawing the company's authority to provide services in the United States.

entries.title: 'I'm afraid of them sending me back': Hear from a mom and daughter waiting for Title 42 decision at southern border
entries.description: After a near-fatal journey from Venezuela, 7-year-old Camila and her mother are waiting at the border near El Paso, Texas, hoping the Biden administration will lift a Trump-era policy that prevents asylum seekers from crossing the border.

entries.title: Elon Musk says he will step down as Twitter CEO — once he finds a replacement
entries.description: Twitter owner Elon Musk confirmed Tuesday evening he will step down as the company's CEO, but only when he identifies a successor, directly addressing for the first time a Twitter poll he created this week in which millions of users voted for his ouster.

entries.title: Retired colonel predicts how Putin will respond to Zelensky's White House visit
entries.description: Col. Cedric Leighton (Ret.) says that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky's planned meeting with President Joe Biden at the White House will send a message to Russian President Vladimir Putin about how united the West is against the invasion.

entries.title: The vote was approved with all 24 Democrats voting in favor of the motion and all 16 Republicans voting no
Putin admits situation in four occupied Ukrainian territories is 'extremely complicated'
US House Committee votes to release Trump's taxes
Artificial intelligence could help work out the best diet for every individual
entries.description: Is broccoli or beetroot the best option for your personal health? Which foods are likely to trigger the biggest glucose spikes or cholesterol surges in your blood?

entries.title: A rare glimpse into the secretive world of sumo wrestling
entries.description: In one of photographer David Sharabani's striking images, two sumo wrestlers face off beneath a roof resembling a Shinto shrine. In another photo, competitors are seen tossing salt high into the air to cleanse the ring; a third shows them with hands raised above their heads, a custom designed to prove that none are carrying weapons.

entries.title: Lawmaker explains what happens next with Trump's tax returns
entries.description: Rep. Lloyd Doggett (D-TX) explains what happens next after the House Ways and Means committee voted along party lines to publicly release material related to former President Donald Trump's 2015-2020 tax returns.

entries.title: Committee said it will redact personal information from Trump's tax documents
entries.description: The House Ways and Means Committee is meeting to discuss former President Donald Trump's tax returns and weigh whether to release the information to the public, the end to a years-long effort from Democrats to learn more about Trump's financial background.

entries.title: Tapper presses TikTok official on Uyghur genocide
entries.description: CNN's Jake Tapper speaks with TikTok Head of Public Policy Michael Beckerman about attempts by US lawmakers to ban the app on government devices over security concerns.

entries.title: 'That was some shade': Ex-Trump official on Boebert's Taylor Greene comments
entries.description: Tension between Republican Reps. Lauren Boebert and Marjorie Taylor Greene has spilled into public view, with the two trading barbs over House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy's campaign to be the next House Speaker.
